thread.title: Two firefighters injured in home fire near Forest Park

title: Two firefighters injured in home fire near Forest Park

UPDATED at 5 p.m., injured firefighters treated and released. 
ST. LOUIS â€¢ Two firefighters were injured Monday at the scene of a fire that damaged a three-story home near Hi Pointe. 
Fire broke out about 9:40 a.m. in a brick dwelling in the 6700 block of Clayton Avenue, across from Dewey Elementary School and just east of Highway 40 (Interstate 64). The male occupant and his two dogs got out safely before the first fire unit arrived, a department spokesman said. 
Capt. Garon Mosby said two firefighters were treated for injuries at an urgent care center and released. They suffered burns while battling the fire inside the third floor. 
The brick home has two full floors and an attic floor with a high sloped roof. Fire appeared contained to the third floor and roof. Mosby described the damage as "extensive." 
Pupils at Dewey school watched the fire from their classroom windows. +11 
Students and adults at the Dewey International Studies Elementary School watch as firefighters battle a blaze in a home in the 6700 block of Clayton Avenue in St. Louis on Monday, Feb. 6, 2017. Photo by Christian Gooden,
